-e ---

# tenû

𓎆 45° turned characters in Sumerian are called 'tenu' tenû turn

Unfortunately sometimes the epiphet tenu is used to denote 90° and 180° rotations as well, conflicting with the wholesale rotation of the Proto-Cuneiform system around 3000 BC.

𒃸 GAN tenu = 𒃷 GAN gunu < 𒃰 GAN

In late forms 𒊺 1+3 ⋍ 𒄭 𒀪 3+1 tenu

𓇯 air
𓇯𓏏 air¬de
󴃙 earth

𒀸 𒀹 ASH 𒄑 𒄕 GIŠ 𒃷 𒃸 GAN 𒉣 𒉩 NUN 𒋾 𒋿 TI 𒍝 𒍞 ZA 𒄩 𒄪 HA 𒋓 𒋔 ŠIR 𒀸 𒀺

𒋛 SI 𒋝 SIK σ sigma
